title: Load Balancing
content:
Module 7, Lesson 2: Load Balancing

Introduction

This lesson covers Load Balancing, a core topic in System Design & Architecture. Mastering this area will help you build reliable, scalable, and maintainable web applications.

Key Concepts

1. Fundamentals

Understanding the foundational principles of Load Balancing ensures you can apply them correctly in a variety of real-world scenarios. Always prefer clarity over cleverness.

2. Practical Application

Theory must translate into working code. In System Design & Architecture, every concept has direct practical implications for how you architect, test, and deploy applications.

3. Common Pitfalls

Awareness of common mistakes in Load Balancing helps you avoid costly bugs and security vulnerabilities. Review real-world examples and practise defensive coding techniques.

4. Best Practices

Industry best practices evolve constantly. Keep up with community standards, read production post-mortems, and participate in code reviews to sharpen your skills in System Design & Architecture.

Summary

You have completed Load Balancing in Module 7. Continue to the next lesson to build further expertise in System Design & Architecture.
